sword1.name: Fighter's Sword
sword1.description: The Fighter's Sword is the first weapon [[Link]] possesses. He receives it from his [[Link's Uncle|Uncle]] in the basement of [[Hyrule Castle (A Link to the Past)|Hyrule Castle]].

sword2.name: Master Sword
sword2.description: The Master Sword is found in the [[Lost Woods (A Link to the Past)|Lost Woods]] and is the second sword. Link is able to draw the weapon from its resting place once he has retrieved the three pendants from the [[Eastern Palace (A Link to the Past)|Eastern Palace]], [[Desert Palace (A Link to the Past)|Desert Palace]], and [[Tower of Hera (A Link to the Past)|Tower of Hera]].

sword3.name: Tempered Sword
sword3.description: Reunite the [[Dwarven Swordsmiths]] and pay them 10 [[Rupee]]s to temper the sword. Return later to obtain the Tempered Sword.

sword4.name: Golden Sword
sword4.description: After obtaining the Tempered Sword and finding the [[Cursed Fairy]] in the [[Pyramid of Power]], Link can throw in the Tempered Sword to receive the Golden Sword upgrade.

shield1.name: Fighter's Shield
shield1.description: The Fighter's Shield is the first shield acquired in the game, and is received from [[Link's Uncle]].

shield2.name: Fire Shield
shield2.description: The Fire Shield is an upgraded version of the Fighter's Shield, as it can protect Link from small fireballs fired by [[River Zora]]s and other creatures.

shield3.name: Mirror Shield
shield3.description: The Mirror Shield is found in [[Turtle Rock (A Link to the Past)|Turtle Rock]]. It is able to reflect lasers from [[Laser Eye]]s.

armor1.name: Green Jerkin
armor1.description: The Green Jerkin is Link's starting [[outfit]], and offers no special protection.

armor2.name: Blue Mail
armor2.description: The Blue Mail is the second outfit found, and is located in the [[Ice Palace]]. It reduces the overall damage Link receives by 50%.

armor3.name: Red Mail
armor3.description: The Red Mail is the third and final outfit, and is located in [[Ganon's Tower (A Link to the Past)|Ganon's Tower]]. It reduces the overall damage Link receives by 75%.

tool1.name: Pegasus Boots
tool1.description: The Pegasus Boots allow Link to charge at high speeds with his sword, as well as smash certain rocks. They are obtained from [[Sahasrahla (A Link to the Past)|Sahasrahla]] after gaining the [[Pendant of Courage]] in the [[Eastern Palace (A Link to the Past)|Eastern Palace].

tool2.name: Power Glove
tool2.description: The Power Gloves allow Link to lift small and large gray stones, and are found in the [[Desert Palace (A Link to the Past)|Desert Palace]].

tool3.name: Titan's Mitt
tool3.description: The Titan's Mitts are the upgraded version of the Power Gloves, allowing Link to lift black rocks. They are acquired in [[Gargoyle's Domain]].

tool4.name: Zora's Flippers
tool4.description: Zora's Flippers allow Link to swim in deeper water without drowning. They can be purchased at the hefty price of 500 [[Rupee]]s at [[Zora's Waterfall]].

tool5.name: Moon Pearl
tool5.description: The Moon Pearl enables Link to keep his original form upon entering the [[Dark World]]. It is obtained in the [[Tower of Hera (A Link to the Past)|Tower of Hera]].

tool6.name: Lamp
tool6.description: The Lamp is the first item found in ''[[The Legend of Zelda: A Link to the Past|A Link to the Past]]''. Found in a chest in [[Link's House|Link's house]], it relies on [[Magic Power|magic]] to light candles found in various places.

tool7.name: Bow
tool7.description: The Bow is a projectile weapon found in the [[Eastern Palace (A Link to the Past)|Eastern Palace]]. Link starts out only being able to carry 30 [[arrow]]s, but can carry as many as 70 by donating Rupees at the [[Pond of Happiness].

tool8.name: Silver Arrow
tool8.description: The Silver Arrows can be found by tossing the bow in the fountain at the [[Pyramid of Power]]. The Silver Arrows are needed to defeat [[Ganon]].

tool9.name: Bomb
tool9.description: The Bombs are explosive items that Link can place to damage walls, enemies, and activate switches. They are available in most shops and can be found in dungeons. [[Link]] starts out only being able to carry 10 bombs at a time, but can hold a maximum of 50 by donating Rupees at the [[Pond of Happiness]].

tool10.name: Boomerang
tool10.description: The Boomerang is a ranged weapon that can be used to stun enemies or activate switches. It is found in [[Hyrule Castle (A Link to the Past)|Hyrule Castle]] on the way to rescuing [[Zelda|Princess Zelda]].

tool11.name: Magical Boomerang
tool11.description: The Magical Boomerang is an upgraded version of the previous Boomerang, having the ability to fly farther and cut down plants. It is found by throwing the normal boomerang into the [[Waterfall of Wishing]].

tool12.name: Bug-Catching Net
tool12.description: The Bug Catching Net is used to catch bugs and fairies. It is given to [[Link]] by the [[Bug-Catching Kid|sick child]] in [[Kakariko Village]].

tool13.name: Hookshot
tool13.description: The Hookshot is an item used to latch on to certain things such as items and chests and draw Link to them like a mechanical Grappling Hook. It is found in the [[Swamp Palace (A Link to the Past)|Swamp Palace]].

tool14.name: Mushroom
tool14.description: The Mushroom is used by Syrup to make [[Magic Powder]]. It can be found in [[Lost Woods (A Link to the Past)|Lost Woods]].

tool15.name: Magic Powder
tool15.description: Magic Powder is an item used to create fires or turn enemies into something else. It is acquired by bringing the [[Mushroom]] from the [[Lost Woods (A Link to the Past)|Lost Woods]] to [[Syrup]].

tool16.name: Fire Rod
tool16.description: The Fire Rod is an item that spits out balls of fire and is capable of burning most enemies. It can also be used to light torches from a distance, and is found in [[Skull Woods (A Link to the Past)|Skull Woods]].

tool17.name: Ice Rod
tool17.description: The Ice Rod is an item that shoots out a blue beam to freeze enemies. It is found in a cave on the eastern shore of [[Lake Hylia]].

tool18.name: Magic Hammer
tool18.description: The Magic Hammer is an item used for flipping over enemies, or penetrating their hard outer shells. It is also used to knock down certain fence posts blocking Link's path, and is found in the [[Dark Palace (A Link to the Past)|Dark Palace]].

tool19.name: Flute
tool19.description: The flute is an instrument used to teleport to one of eight locations via bird-travel. It is acquired by digging it up in the [[Haunted Grove]].

tool20.name: Book of Mudora
tool20.description: The Book of Mudora is a book used to translate the Ancient Hyrulean Language in various places throughout the game. It is found in the [[House of Books]] south of Kakariko Village.

tool21.name: Shovel
tool21.description: [[Link]] can use the shovel to help find [[Flute Boy|Flute Boy's]] flute. It is replaced with the Flute afterwards.

tool22.name: Cane of Somaria
tool22.description: The Cane of Somaria is used to create blocks out of thin air, and is found in the sixth dungeon: [[Misery Mire (A Link to the Past)|Misery Mire]].

tool23.name: Cane of Byrna
tool23.description: The Cane of Byrna is used to protect [[Link]] by rapidly spinning around him, forming a protective barrier against most enemies. It is found in a cave on [[Death Mountain]].

tool24.name: Magic Cape
tool24.description: The Magic Cape is used to turn Link invisible, rendering him invincible for a short time as well as allowing him to pass through obstacles. It can be found in the [[Hyrulian Cemetery]] in the [[Light World]].

tool25.name: Magic Mirror
tool25.description: The Magic Mirror is used to transport Link from the [[Dark World]] to the corresponding location in the [[Light World]], leaving a portal for him to return if needed. It is acquired from the [[Lost Old Man]] inside [[Death Mountain]].

tool26.name: Ether Medallion
tool26.description: The Ether Medallion calls down a strike of lightning, attacking all enemies on screen. Any enemy that is not destroyed is frozen as if hit with the Ice Rod. Ether can be found on a bridge west of the [[Tower of Hera (A Link to the Past)|Tower of Hera]]. A green tablet, that needs the [[Book of Mudora]] to translate it, tells [[Link]] to raise the [[Master Sword]] to the sky. Ether is needed to clear the skies in Misery Mire.

tool27.name: Quake Medallion
tool27.description: [[Link]] slams his sword into the ground, unleashing a shockwave that will either destroy an enemy or turn them into a Slime. The Quake Medallion can be found at the [[Lake of Ill Omen]] in a circle of stones. By throwing a rock into the circle, a [[Catfish]] will appear and offer Link the medallion. Quake is needed to open Turtle Rock.

tool28.name: Bombos Medallion
tool28.description: [[Link]] sends out a ring of fire from his sword, destroying all enemies on the screen. The Bombos Medallion can be found by going to the swamp in the [[Dark World]], and use the [[Magic Mirror]] to end up on a cliff in the [[Desert of Mystery]]. Use the [[Book of Mudora]] to read the tablet.

tool29.description: The Magic Bottle is a container used to store various things such as [[fairy|fairies]], [[potion]]s, and bees.

tool30.name: Red Potion
tool30.description: The Red Potion restores all of [[Link|Link's]] hearts. It can be bought at the [[Magic Shop]] for 120 Rupees.

tool31.description: The Green Potion restores all of [[Link|Link's]] magic power. It can be bought at the [[Magic Shop]] for 60 Rupees.

tool32.name: Blue Potion
tool32.description: The Blue Potion restores all of [[Link|Link's]] hearts and magic power. It can be bought at the [[Magic Shop]] for 160 Rupees.

tool33.description: Fairies restore [[Link|Link's]] hearts, or if the heart gauge is emptied, revive Link to a maximum of 8 hearts.

tool34.name: Bee
tool34.description: When released from a [[bottle]], a bee attacks several times before flying off. It can be found by dashing into trees with the [[Pegasus Boots]].

tool35.name: Golden Bee
tool35.description: The Golden Bee is like the normal bee, but does more damage and never flies away from [[Link]]. It can be found in a cave next to the [[Ice Rod]].

tool36.name: Super Bomb
tool36.description: The Super Bomb is needed to open up the [[Cursed Fairy]]. It can be bought from the [[Dark World]]'s [[Bomb Shop]] for 100 Rupees.

tool37.name: Basket (GBA only)
tool37.description: The Basket can only be found in the [[The Legend of Zelda: A Link to the Past (GBA)|GBA remake]]. It is used during the [[Riddle Quest]].

tool38.name: Wooden Carvings (GBA only)
tool38.description: The Wooden Carvings can only be found in the [[The Legend of Zelda: A Link to the Past (GBA)|GBA remake]]. They are a reward from the [[Riddle Quest]].

tool39.name: Dungeon Map
tool39.description: The Dungeon Map shows the layout of the current dungeon.

tool40.name: Compass
tool40.description: The Compass shows where items and the boss are located within a dungeon.

tool41.name: Big Key
tool41.description: The Big Key opens the Big Chest and the door to the boss of a given dungeon.

tool42.description: The Small Key opens a locked door in a dungeon. Each is only used in one dungeon, where it permanently unlocks one door, but can only be used once.

tool43.name: Pendant of Courage
tool43.description: Found in the [[Eastern Palace (A Link to the Past)|Eastern Palace]] after defeating the [[Armos Knight (A Link to the Past)|Armos Knights]].

tool44.name: Pendant of Power
tool44.description: Found in the [[Desert Palace (A Link to the Past)|Desert Palace]] after defeating the [[Lanmola (A Link to the Past)|Lanmolas]].

tool45.name: Pendant of Wisdom
tool45.description: Found in the [[Tower of Hera (A Link to the Past)|Tower of Hera]] after defeating the [[Moldorm (A Link to the Past)|Moldorm]].

tool46.name: Crystal
tool46.description: Found in each [[Dark World]] dungeon by defeating the boss within.

tool47.name: Heart Piece
tool47.description: Each time Link collects 4 Pieces of Heart, a full Heart Container will be added to his overall health. Completing each major dungeon and collecting all 24 Pieces of Heart will give Link the maximum of 20 full Heart Containers.

location24.name: House of Books in Kakariko Village

location25.name: Flute Boy in Dark World Haunted Grove

location31.name: Random Chest or Vender in Kakariko Village

location37.name: Dark World Shield Shop Or Mysterious Pond
